notesStmt.note:
Avraham ben Ya῾aḳov: inscribed with his name in an owner's inscription (folio 287v).
Kalonymos Finziim (Panziim?; of the Finzi/ Panzi family?: inscribed with his name in an owner’s inscription, undated (folio 1r).
Laurentius Franguellus (fl. until 1596): inscribed with his name, 1575 (folio 286r); see William Popper, The Censorship of Hebrew Books (New York: KTAV Publishing House, 1969), p. 78, appendix § 105-110. Camillo Jaghel: inscribed with his name, 1611 (folio 286r); see William Popper, The Censorship of Hebrew Books (New York: KTAV Publishing House, 1969), appendix § 50-56.
Antonio Franc. Enriques (fl. in Urbino): inscribed with his name, 1688 (folio 286r); see William Popper, The Censorship of Hebrew Books (New York: KTAV Publishing House, 1969), appendix § 44. Marginal inscription: an attempt to copy Franguellus' signature (folio 103v).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A festival prayer book, according to the Italian rite.

collation.p: 29 quires: i-xxviii10 (folios 1-280), xxixten (folios 281-286, 286a, 287). Catchwords. Quire numeration on the recto of the first folios in Arabic numbers.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the 15th century, partially punctuated.

decoDesc.decoNote: 1r 3 frontispieces with initial-word panels and full borders, in colours and gold.
27v 3 frontispieces with initial-word panels and full borders, in colours and gold.
30v 3 frontispieces with initial-word panels and full borders, in colours and gold.
287r1 full-page miniature including the first owner’s inscription.
Numerous initial-word panels and initial words accompanied with foliate scrolls or floral motifs and sometimes with animals or birds, in colours and gold.

binding.p: Pre-1600. Red velvet, with clasps. Rebound in-house in brown leather (both bindings preserved). Spine: 'Machazor Liber Precum. Hebraice. Mus. Brit. Jure Emptionis. 16,577. Plut.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Acquired by the British Museum in 1847.
